body: This has been fixed.

> What is the difference between that and `https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pulsar-client-go`?

@Sunkwan-Kwon 

This is a native go client(https://github.com/apache/pulsar-client-go).

This is a cgo client(https://github.com/apache/pulsar/tree/master/pulsar-client-go)

Once feature parity and stability are reached, this will supersede the current CGo based library.
retest this please

Closed this issue since we are providing scripts for cutting documentation for minor releases.

@Jennifer88huang I don't think we can delete unlinked pages because those pages are required for old versions. It is a limitation of our current documentation framework. I am closing this issue for now. If we have a better framework, we can revisit this issue again.

FYI. It is an issue when you are using a version of maven which is older than 3.5. You can fix the issue by upgrading maven to be newer than 3.5.

We are moving to Github Actions. This is not required anymore.
@abhilashmandaliya the fix is not in 2.4.2. It went into 2.5.0.

FWIW, @devinbost I am suspicious of the netty version in the 2.4.X stream. There is a know memory usage issue (https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/8814) in the 4.1.32 version of netty that is used in the stream. When I was testing, I would see issues like you are describing. Then I patched in the latest version of netty, and things seemed better. I have been running with a patched 2.4.2 for a while and have not seen any issues. You may be experiencing something completely different, but it might be worth trying 2.4.2 + latest netty.

Instrumenting Prometheus might be more work than anticipated.

I ran into a blocking issue due to missing features in the Go client of Prometheus and got some pushback from one of their maintainers when I asked about getting those features.
I'm discussing the issue with them, but we will likely need to work around the issue since they don't seem very eager to add the desired functionality. 
For reference, see the discussion here: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/prometheus-users/3480a316-748c-4351-8a15-1ac88971fd24%40googlegroups.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer
This is not needed issue is unclean workspace which requires a purge of files manually closing this for now.

> @bry00 we have just published 2.4.2 python client for osx 10.15. Can you try it again?

It does not work yet:
```bash
# python3
Python 3.7.5 (default, Dec 12 2019, 09:41:03)
[Clang 11.0.0 (clang-1100.0.33.16)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pulsar
Segmentation fault: 11
```
So, we probably need to have the Prometheus wiring in a different PR due to its complexity and the larger changes that will be required.
I'll be away until next week. If there's something I need to do to fix these validation failures, let me know. I can't imagine what, though.

@sijie ping. Can we please merge this one asap as it happens very often.
@merlimat this is related to PIP-51.
I made the changes that I could. Regarding everything that wasn't modified, please see my replies to the comments.

I'm not understanding the purpose of this fix. A "blank" string shouldn't be allowed as a cluster name. 

Per the original issue, it seems to me that the requirement should be to pre-fill the allowed clusters to local cluster if it's empty, same as it happens on the CLI tool.
run java8 tests
retest this please

@merlimat Thanks for pointing this. The original of this fix [(f7772ec)](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/6027/commits/f7772ecfa2a0b986a8b45fe9844ccc69bf71cddf) is trying to make the rest requests consistent with the CLI tool actions. Form my point of view, the main issue there is using globally available clusters via method `getClusters()` included `local` clusters.

@sijie I took a look, maybe not solve my previous comment. I think @wolfstudy can add a unit test to ensure the dispatcher can handle the policy update. because your current unit test works on zookeeper (write policy data to zookeeper and get policy data from zookeeper), this does not ensure that the dispatcher can work well with policy update.
